Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can correctly identify and draw two different habitats, one land-based and one water-based.
The student can observe and illustrate various living things (e.g., plants and animals) present in each habitat.
The student can differentiate and label the types of living things found in the land habitat (e.g., trees, grasses, lizards, squirrels).
The student can differentiate and label the types of living things found in the water habitat (e.g., fish, clams, aquatic plants).
The student can visually compare and contrast the diversity of plants and animals between the two habitats.
The student can identify and represent patterns of biodiversity by showing how different living things exist in various environments.
